definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: In compliance with your request, we have instructed the bank to open the L/C in a few days.
sentences.chinese: 應你方的要求，我們已通知銀行在幾日內開立信用證。

sentences.english: Could you provide us with the requisite financial information so that we can open your new account immediately?
sentences.chinese: 煩請提供有關的財務資料，以能立即開立賬戶。

sentences.english: We shall open a letter of credit in your favour to be settled in US dollars.
sentences.chinese: 我們將開立以你方爲收益人的信用證，以美元結算。

sentences.english: Please inform us your difficulty in opening the credit.
sentences.chinese: 請見信後即告你方在開立信用證上究竟有何困難。

sentences.english: I open a letter of credit in Renminbi with a bank in U. S. A.
sentences.chinese: 我在美國的一家銀行開立了人民幣信用狀。

sentences.english: After the license is approved, we shall establish an L/C in your favor.
sentences.chinese: 許可證批准後，我們就開立以你方爲受益人的信用證。

sentences.english: I open a letter of credit in Renminbi with a bank in USA.
sentences.chinese: 我在美國的一家銀行開立了人民幣信用證。

sentences.english: And I'll arrange for the Letter of Credit to be opened in your favor as soon as I get home.
sentences.chinese: 我一回往馬上着手辦理開立以你方爲受益人的信用證。

sentences.english: It do not matter whether you airmail or cable the credit.
sentences.chinese: 用空郵或電報開立信用證均可。

sentences.english: You know, it will involve great expense to open a L/C with a bank in our country.
sentences.chinese: 您知道，在敝國找銀行開立信用證要花去許多費用。

sentences.english: Payment is due within 60 days of the invoice date .
sentences.chinese: 請在發貨單開立之日起60開以內付款。

sentences.english: Does it matter where I open an individual retirement account?
sentences.chinese: 我在哪裏開立個人退休帳戶有關係嗎？

sentences.english: Opening of a private account for the funds of a unit.
sentences.chinese: 將單位的資金以個人名義開立帳戶存儲的。

sentences.english: You'll have a deposit certificate in the name of the depositor.
sentences.chinese: 那就要一張以儲戶名字開立的定期存單。

sentences.english: The doctor felt his pulse and gave him a prescription.
sentences.chinese: 醫生爲他診脈並開立藥方。

sentences.english: Application charges shall be made against the operating department issued with the chits.
sentences.chinese: 申請費用應由運營部門開立單據進行支付。

definition: to issue (a document)/to sign and issue officially
to freeze (water etc)/(fig.) to freeze (assets, prices etc)
to transfer (money to a bank account)
to report (to the authorities)/to declare (to customs)
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
